definition: lit. to continuously revolve/to work non-stop/to work around the clock (idiom)
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
surname Lian
axis/axle/spool (for thread)/roller (for scrolls)/classifier for calligraphy rolls etc
see 壓軸戲|压轴戏[ya1 zhou4 xi4]/Taiwan pr. [zhou2]
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

sentences.english: After two days of nonstop working, our crew members went nuts.
sentences.chinese: 这两天工作连轴转，组员们都快疯了。

sentences.english: We can only get the goods ready if the factory works round the clock .
sentences.chinese: 只有工厂连轴转工作，我们才能把货准备好。

definition: day and night/regardless of the time of day or night
without stopping to sleep or have a rest (idiom)
night and day (idiom); continuous strenuous effort
busy/bustling
to leave early and return late (idiom)
busy/hurriedly/to hurry/to rush
three-shift system (work rostering)
shift working

day and night/round-the-clock
to be up to one's ears in work (idiom)/to be unable to attend to other things at the same time
to be industrious, rising early and going to bed late
overnight until daybreak (idiom); all night long/day and night
physically and emotionally exhausted
